metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3902 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the setupprocess in phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.10, 4.2.x before 4.2.13.3, 4.3.xbefore 4.3.13.1, and 4.4.x before 4.4.6.1 allow remote attackers to hijackthe authentication of administrators for requests that modify theconfiguration file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.4.6.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.4.6.1-1').
